intro: Vandenboschia chevalieri, commonly known as the Cape grass, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, reducing water loss. Vandenboschia chevalieri is known for its resilience and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
